intro: Morisonia speciosa, commonly known as the showy morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowers like evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking, fragrant, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a soft, hairy texture. Morisonia speciosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
